articles.title: Greetings to Pakistani President
articles.content:
Greetings to Iranian President
   Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to Iranian President Seyed Mohammad Khatami on March 21 on the occasion of Iran's New Year.   The message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Iran will further expand and strengthen in different domains in the New Year.   It wished the Iranian President and people greater successes in the work for the prosperity of their country and him good health and happiness.

articles.title: Message of greetings to LAS secretary general
articles.content:
Greetings to Pakistani President
    Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to Pakistani President Muhammad Rafiq Tarar on Mar. 21 on the occasion of the Day of Pakistan.   In the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Pakistan will continue to develop on good terms in conformity with the two peoples' interests, the message wished the Pakistani President and people greater successes in the struggle for the independent development of their country.

articles.title: S. Korea's scheme to intensify drills of reserve forces
articles.content:
Message of greetings to LAS secretary general
   Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a message of greetings to secretary general of the League of Arab States Ahmed Esmat Abdul Maguid on the occasion of its 54th foundation anniversary.   The message said that the foundation of the LAS  was an important event of great significance in the history of Arab nations.   It expressed the belief that the good relations of friendship and cooperation existing between the DPRK  and Arab countries would further strengthen and develop and wished the secretary general greater success in his responsible work.

articles.title: Violations of human rights denounced
articles.content:
S. Korea's scheme to intensify drills of reserve forces
    Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- The South Korean authorities plan to stage military drills of reserve forces with the mobilization of more inhabitants, said a Seoul-based radio.   According to the plan, 40% of over 460,000 reservists of over 90 occupational categories who have been excluded from training of reserve forces will be hurled again into military exercises which will begin next year.   Among them are drill teachers of high schools, itinerant lecturers on family planning and locomotive engineers and other employees.   This proves that the South Korean rulers are further reinforcing manpower as well as lethal equipment in an attempt to round off preparations for a war against the north.

articles.title: DPRK's persevering efforts to build powerful nation
Ill-intentioned move against DPRK
Chongryon calls for massive patriotic movement
Suppression of pro-reunification patriotic forces
Preparatory committees formed abroad
articles.content:
Suppression of pro-reunification patriotic forces
   Pyongyang, March  22 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun today in a signed commentary denounces the South Korean rulers for sentencing to prison a member of the "Chollima Singing Group", a group of students, who sang songs of the north, and urges them to stop the fascist suppression of the pro-reunification patriotic forces.    The news analyst says:   It is natural that north's songs loved by foreigners were sung by fellow countrymen in the south. Students' forming a "Chollima Singing Group" and singing songs of the north should not be incriminated in any case.
    The South Korean rulers never let a chance pass by without talking about "engagement policy".    Whom and how can they engage while failing to embrace even those who sang songs of the north?   "Improved inter-Korean relations" and "reconciliation and cooperation" loud-mouthed by them are nothing but a window-dressing.   They are now employing every base move to dampen the ever growing desire of the South Korean people to achieve reunification through reconciliation with the north and communism and to impair the high authority of the north.

articles.title: Letter to UNSC president
articles.content:
Preparatory committees formed abroad
     Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Preparatory committees have  been inaugurated in different countries to commemorate the 87th birth anniversary of the President Kim Il Sung.    The deputy prime minister and Minister of Education, Youth and Sports of Cambodia who is also general secretary of the Funcinpec Party was elected chairman of the Cambodian preparatory committee while the Minister of State for Water, Territory and Environment was elected co-chairman of the  Ugandan preparatory committee.   A Congolese preparatory committee fixed the period between March 15 and April 16 as a commemoration month.   Preparatory committees decided to hold colorful events including photo exhibitions, lecture meetings and reading sessions around Sun's Day.
